meanings.definition: A person who continues or maintains something, especially a tradition or belief.
meanings.sent1: The perpetuators of the family recipes ensure they are passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The perpetuators of the ancient rituals gathered to perform the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The perpetuators of the bedtime story tradition never run out of tales to tell.
meanings.sent4: The perpetuators of kindness spread warmth like a cozy blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The perpetuators of the school spirit always cheer the loudest at games.

meanings.definition: A group or organization that perpetuates a certain behavior or practice.
meanings.sent1: The perpetuators of the recycling program ensure everyone participates in keeping the environment clean.
meanings.sent2: The perpetuators of the gossip circle were always eager to share the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The perpetuators of the office potluck made sure there was never a shortage of delicious food.
meanings.sent4: The perpetuators of the fashion trends set the style for the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The perpetuators of the neighborhood watch kept a vigilant eye on any suspicious activity.
